channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup - Grand Final
item.description:
Sunday, August 20, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Light Blue, Yellow and Orange to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup - Grand Final.

The 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup has been co-hosted across venues in Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia and now it’s time for the Grand Final! 

Head to the Fan Festival™ at South Bank Parklands, to watch the Match live as well as enjoying an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games. 

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:summary: FIFA Women's World Cup - Grand Final

item.title: Queensland Road Safety Week
item.description:
Monday, August 21, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Yellow to support Queensland Road Safety Week.

“Road Safety Starts with Me.”  With 299 lives lost on Queensland roads through 2022 - the highest since 2009 - road safety is a key priority for our state. Queensland Road Safety Week (QRSW) is an annual initiative led by TMR with the Queensland Police Service and is designed to raise awareness of road safety through a range of activities and promotions.

This Light Up is organised by: Dept of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

This Light Up is organised by: Dept of Transport and Main Roads

item.title: Brain Injury Awareness Week
item.description:
Tuesday, August 22, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Brain Injury Awareness Week.

The annual Brain Injury Awareness Week raises awareness of brain injury and its impact. The week also celebrates the achievements of those living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in.

Synapse is Australia’s Brain Injury Organisation, providing a range of support services for people who have been impacted by brain injury and disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Synapse Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Fashion Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, August 22, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Brisbane Fashion Festival.

The annual Brisbane Fashion Festival which will be held at City Hall/King George Square Tuesday 22 - Thursday 24 August, 2023. The Festival is designed to support the local fashion and retail scene at the time when new season fashions land in store, and support our emerging designers along with our established designers and retailers.

This Light Up is organised by: Lindsay Bennett Marketing Pty Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Brisbane Fashion Festival.

The Festival is designed to support the local fashion and retail scene at the time when new season fashions land in store, and support our emerging designers along with our established designers and retailers.
This Light Up is organised by: Lindsay Bennett Marketing Pty Ltd
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of 9 years to 2032 Paralympics
item.description:
Wednesday, August 23, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to support Eve of 9 years to 2032 Paralympics.

24 August 2023 marks 9 years to the start Brisbane 2032 Paralympic games. The Brisbane 2032 Paralympic Games will create a legacy, which aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to support Eve of 9 years to 2032 Paralympics.
24 August 2023 marks 9 years to the start Brisbane 2032 Paralympic games. The Brisbane 2032 Paralympic Games will create a legacy, which aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: IndOz Conference
item.description:
Thursday, August 24, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and White to celebrate IndOz Conference.

IndOz Conference taking place in City Hall - the largest Indonesian Business event in Australia, to further Trades and Investments between Australia and Indonesia.

This Light Up is organised by: Synergy of Indonesia Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Ukraine Independence Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 24, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and Yellow to recognise Ukraine Independence Day.

Ukrainian Community Groups of Brisbane are celebrating 32 years on Ukraine’s Independence on 24th August.

This Light Up is organised by: Ukrainian Community of Qld

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition
item.description:
Friday, August 25, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit White, Blue, Yellow, Green and Black to support Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition.

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.
This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

item.description:
Friday, August 25, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit White, Blue, Yellow, Green and Black to support Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition.

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Dress to Express Day
item.description:
Friday, August 25, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple and Orange to support Dress to Express Day.

"Dress to Express" Day will be the last event of Brisbane Fashion Festival and will take place in Queen St Mall and in schools/workplaces across Queensland. On this day, community members are encouraged to dress to express their unique style, in solidarity with DV survivors who are taking back control of their lives including, for many, what they choose to wear.

This Light Up is organised by: Beyond DV Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Gala Ball
item.description:
Saturday, August 26, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to support Gala Ball.

The Ladybird Gala Dinner taking place in City Hall is an annual event to raise awareness and funds for the ongoing work of the charity to enable our mission of offering free mental health support to any bereaved parent that seeks it.

This Light Up is organised by: Ladybird Care Foundation Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 1 year to Paris 2024 Paralympics
item.description:
Monday, August 28, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Red Blue White to celebrate 1 year to Paris 2024 Paralympics.

One year from today Paris 2024 will host the XXXIII Paralympic Summer Games, 28 August to 8 September 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Legacy Appeal Week
item.description:
Monday, August 28, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red Blue White to support Legacy Appeal Week.

Legacy supports 40,000 partners and children of veterans who gave their lives or health serving our country
The Legacy Week appeal has been running since the 1940’s and is a time for all Australians to show their support for the widows and children whose loved ones have served our country. See also https://www.legacy.com.au/legacy-week/.

This Light Up is organised by: Legacy Club of Brisbane

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description: The Story Bridge will be lit Red Blue White to support Legacy Appeal Week. Legacy supports 40,000 partners and children of veterans who gave their lives or health serving our country The Legacy Week appeal has been running since the 1940’s and is a time for all Australians to show their support for the widows and children whose loved ones have served our country. See also https://www.legacy.com.au/legacy-week/. This Light Up is organised by: Legacy Club of Brisbane

item.title: International Overdose Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, August 29, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support International Overdose Awareness Day.

International Overdose Awareness Day is the world’s largest annual campaign to end overdose, remember without stigma those who have died and acknowledge the grief of the family and friends left behind.
The campaign raises awareness of overdose, which is one of the world’s worst public health crises, and stimulates action and discussion about evidence-based overdose prevention and drug policy.

It also acknowledges the profound grief felt by families and friends whose loved ones have died or suffered permanent injury from a drug overdose, spreading the message about the tragedy of drug overdose death and that drug overdose is preventable.

QuIHN is an organisation founded by the communities for which we exist & serve. We provide a range of specialist social and medical services relating to alcohol, other drug use and mental health, comprising of harm reduction programs, therapeutic programs and primary medical care.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Injectors Health Network Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

The campaign raises awareness of overdose, which is one of the world’s worst public health crises, and stimulates action and discussion about evidence-based overdose prevention and drug policy.
It also acknowledges the profound grief felt by families and friends whose loved ones have died or suffered permanent injury from a drug overdose, spreading the message about the tragedy of drug overdose death and that drug overdose is preventable.
QuIHN is an organisation founded by the communities for which we exist & serve. We provide a range of specialist social and medical services relating to alcohol, other drug use and mental health, comprising of harm reduction programs, therapeutic programs and primary medical care.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Injectors Health Network Limited

item.title: Eve of Daffodil Day
item.description:
Wednesday, August 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Eve of Daffodil Day.

Cancer Council Queensland aim to support all Queenslanders living with cancer, and inform them of the support services we can offer through a cancer diagnosis, for themselves, their families or support networks. The annual Daffodil Day appeal raises awareness and funds to help the Cancer Council Australia achieve its objectives.

This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Eve of Daffodil Day.

The annual Daffodil Day appeal raises awareness and funds to help the Cancer Council Australia achieve its objectives.
This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland

item.title: Eve of National Wattle Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 31, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support Eve of National Wattle Day.

National Wattle Day occurs on 1 September each year. This Day creates awareness that Golden Wattle is Australia's national floral emblem, and is our national colours of Green and Gold - worn are with pride by our sporting champions. The Golden Wattle is a unifying symbol for all Australians in times of peace and conflict.
Wattle Day Association promotes the celebration of National Wattle Day and the celebration of our national Floral Emblem the Golden Wattle as the symbol of Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Wattle Day Association Inc

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Malaysia National day
item.description:
Thursday, August 31, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, Blue, White, Yellow to recognise Malaysia National day.

Malaysia's Independence Day is celebrated on August 31st. Also known as Merdeka Day (Freedom Day).

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Malaysian Business Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
